intro: Curcuma longispica, commonly known as the long-spurred turmeric, is a member of the Zingiberaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia, and is characterized by its striking, elongated floral spurs. The plant features large, narrow leaves and produces vivid orange-yellow rhizomes that are often used in traditional medicine. Its flowers are typically fragrant and have a unique, spurred structure that distinguishes it from other curcuma species. The botanical features of Curcuma longispica make it a valuable ornamental and medicinal plant in tropical regions.
